resources.string: Pantnagar, about 70 km from Nainital , is the nearest airport with direct ights to Delhi. From here you have to either hire a cab or take a bus.

Kathgodam, 35 km away, is the nearest railhead. Trains link the town to Delhi, Kolkata, Dehradun and Lucknow. From Kathgodam, there are taxis available on shared seat basis, for those on shoestring budgets. Regular cabs and buses are also at your service

There is a great network of both AC and non AC buses to and from Nainital. Nainital is well connected with all the neighboring cities thought roads. Most of the tourists prefer to reach Nainital by road.

A former British health resort, Nainital also has quite a bit of history to intrigue the travelers visiting the land. Just like other Indian hill stations of Mussoorie, Darjeeling and Kodaikanal, the British were the first to discover the town of Nainital and push it to prominence
Nainital - The Lake District of India :-

Nainital is one of the most charismatic hill stations that India harbors. Nainital boasts of Nine different lakes, shares its boundary with one of the most visited National Parks (Corbett National Park only 60 kms) in the country, has Lush Green Valley view of the Hills and lower forested ridges and obviously is part of the Mighty Glittering Himalayan Range. Nainital is a must visit destination for any nature lover who wants to move out of the chaotic city life and be in the lap of nature.
For Hotel Booking , Local Guide and other information Contact-
N a i n i L a k e a natural freshwater lake in Nainital provides the tourists opportunities of boating and yachting.

Being a hill station, Nainital offers its visitors a large number of trekking options, amidst the scenic beauty of nature. The most popular trails include Nainital Betalghat Trek, Nainital Binayak Trek, Nainital Kainchi Trek, Nainital Kilbury Trek, Nainital Kunjakharak Trek, and Snow View Trek
Rock climbing helps you test your physical and mental limits. "This wonderful activity also help you in conquering newer potentials
Your search for an adventurous and thrilling experience stops here. Venture into this exciting activity and see the world upside down
If you are an adventure enthusiast and want to have some fun, then come to Nainatal for water zorbing activity
Rappelling is a form of adventure activity, in which an administered decent is done from a vertical or steep slope, with the help of a harness and rope

A visit to Nainital cannot be complete unless and until you get a taste of horse riding especially in the Mall area. Apart from that, you can also hire a horse or pony for going to Snow View Point, Tifn Top, and Kilburi, from the Mallital area

The Para gliders can fly in the air for hours with the help of the glider and climb to altitudes, more than 10,000 feet high .Paraliding activities in Nainital are operated in surrounding areas of Naukuchiatal, Bhimtal
Address: Kaladungi Road | Mallital, Nainital, India

A curry, which is prepared with a combination of various Daals and is usually eaten during the winter season, with steamed rice and Bhang ki Chutney. It is prepared in a huge iron pan, since people believe it adds to the food’s nutritional value. A semi-liquid dish, Raas is made in varying levels of spicy-ness to suit different taste-buds.
This is a prominent part of festivals and celebrations in Nainital and is made of rice paste and plain flour. This dish usually acts as a dry accompaniment to curry-dishes.
A favourite among locals, this is made with a combination of Arhar, Moong and Chana Dals. To add that extra punch, some preparations also include the zingy flavour of Bhaang and Sesame seeds.

This chocolate like fudge is actually prepared by roasting khoya till it turns a muddy brown, and is then coated with white sugar balls. The best place to try out this one is Bada Bazaar, where this sweet is still prepared at old shops. Most of these are very specific to the locals in Nainital, cooked mostly in their homes and on festivals. It might be hard to find at usual restaurants in Nainital, unless on rare, speiscial festivals and events. If you rent a cottage and have a cook-on-board, you could perhaps request him/her to cook up a typical food of Nainital. The staff at the hotel where you’re staying might also be able to point you towards some offbeat places for local food. Or if it’s your lucky day, they might even offer to cook a meal for you at their homes!

Manu Maharani Hotel Nainital has 4 stars with 67 rooms in Nainital - Uttarakhand , rated 8.7 /10,Very Good. This hotel is about 40 km. from Pantnagar Airport (PGH), Nainital. Number of rooms: 67

Address- near Bus Station ,Nainital ,India. It is one of the oldest hotel in Nainital.The distinguished feature of ashok hotel is that as you step down from automobile, you donot have to climb at all.Pick up your dates,contact us for reservation and prepare for memorable holidays..

Hotel Maharaja is an intimate owner managed budget hotel on Zoo Road (Upper Mall) with 24 neat and clean rooms fitted with all modern amenities. The hotel faces the lake and you can enjoy fabulous views of the town and the lake from the verandahs. We have a variety of accommodation options for couples, families and groups to suit specific needs of our guests. We pride ourselves in personalized service, good food and comfortable stay. The rooms have wooden paneling and are warm and comfortable
